website_summaries.verdict: This docking station offers Thunderbolt 3 connections and various other inputs/outputs.
pros: Large body offers several different types of connections, making it useful for hosting different accessories and storage devices
cons: Connections to external devices and accessories are often dropped temporarily

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - Don't Order
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and both of them are very "glitchy". My keyboards work fine most of the time but then occasionally, they lag really bad. When the keyboard is plugged directly into the MacBook Pro, no problems. Also, the sound port doesn't always sound right and I have to jiggle the jack. Doesn't matter which sound device is plugged in, same issue. And sometimes my machine won't get any signal to my external monitor. So I have to restart to make it work. None of these problems from my Belkin Express Docks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Terry

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a good review but...
customer_reviews.text: So the first thing I do when I get a device like this is to test all the ports on it to make sure they are working properly. Everything worked except for two of the four USB 3.0 ports on the back. It was the two closest to the Gigabit Ethernet port (Top and Bottom). Sadly I have to return it because as a new item at this price I expect everything to be in working order. Overall the docking station is solidly built and looks good. As long as you do not get a defective one it is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: RandomAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Working with a Lenovo Yoga C930
customer_reviews.text: Working with a Lenovo Yoga C930. At first I was worried that two of the USB ports did not work. However, they sent a replacement in just two days, and I still had the problem that two of the four back USB 3.0 ports would not work. Contacted their support team, they responded very quickly and directed me to a new USB driver. Once I installed that, all USB ports are now working. I have two monitors connected, one from the DisplayPort to HDMI adapter that was provided, and the second is connected to the Thunderbolt 3 port via an HDMI adapter. Both monitors are working
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Power Supply Problem
customer_reviews.text: After less than 6 months in use, the power supply for this dock went dead. I contacted Plugable Tech Support, who provided a replacement power brick. Then, with less than 2 months in use, the replacement power brick went dead. I've given up trying - the dock works fine, the Chicony power supply bricks fail prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: An incredibly expensive waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I needed this product to do the following: 1) connect a keyboard 2) connect a monitor 3) connect an SD card reader to import photos The product does the folling reliably: 1) make me incredibly frustrated as the connect monitor times out every 4–6 minutes, keyboard doesn't connect, and SD cards are not recognized by my computer. Do not be a shmuck like me and dump 250 dollars on a piece of good-looking garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: The Pluggable is the only one which could do multiple monitors.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for thunderbolt 3 adapter with multi-monitor connectivity. I tried two other brands and those could not do even though I tried various combination. However, this product just worked without any hassle. I connected one to DP and the other to USB-C. It just worked with the maxi-resolution. I have had Pluggable for USB3 connection. I should have bought this first. But when I searched for thunderbolt3 adapter, this somehow did not show up. That is the only reason I went through other products. If you are looking for one for PC (I can't say for Mac), this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Dead after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product until it stop working today. I've been using it for almost 2 months since I purchased it. I've had an external BluRay Drive, and two external monitors (one through a DisplayPort to HDMI connection and the other through the usb-c connection), and the device just shut off, as if the power went out. It won't turn back on and it seems to have messed up. That's too bad because I really thought I had purchased the best dock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dell XPS
customer_reviews.text: Works as described on Dell XPS. Love it! I'm using the supplied DisplayPort HDMI adaptor with a single monitor. USB ports handle backup drive, wireless keyboard, etc. Installation was easy. A recent Windows 10 update caused all the USB ports to suddenly fail. When the online fixes didn't work, I emailed Customer Support and they replied with the fix within an hour. Very pleased. I highly recommend this dock and the manufacturer. The only negative is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Random USB Problems
customer_reviews.text: Got a mid-2019 RBP Advanced and hoped to use this guy as a nifty little thing into which all the USB devices could be plugged. Then I kinda went wild getting stands from Razer for the Blade and the new headset. Windows was throwing Device Error 43's at me like it was handing out birth control pills at the clinic. After hours of WTF and messing with things, unplugged all USB devices from this dock and everything magically started behaving. Whoops.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: External Monitor Not Working Properly
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2017, Two Thunderbolt 3 ports) hooked up to an HP 2159m monitor via HDMI into the DisplayPort adapter provided with the hub. I'm unable to get the external monitor to display properly, the menu across the top and the dock on the bottom of the screen are not visible. Is this a Mac problem, a monitor problem, a hub problem? The monitor was fine before, but I wasn't using the HDMI hookup with my older MacBook Pro. I would be happy to give this a better rating if I knew why this problem is happening. My monitor displayed properly before using this hub and an HDMI connection.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well-built and well-engineered product, backed by fantastic customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Lot's a metal here, very durable constructed. The base has enough heft that it is difficult to knock it over in normal use (vertical orientation.) Lot's of ports and they work well. 5 USB A and 1 USB C. I had trouble getting the ethernet to work at first (which ended up being an issue with my power line setup) and the tech support is superb. They are quick to respond, provide lot's of troubleshooting advice and really seem to care that the product exceeds your expectations. I cannot recommend this dock enough.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Klein

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Dell XPS13
customer_reviews.text: Does what is advertised (although we do not use two monitors, etc.) I wonder if it has the oomph to power something bigger like a Dell XPS15, but it works for the intended notebook. The key, of course, is how long it will work a the Dell Thunderbolt docks we bought fail (one during warranty and two just after the warranty period). Will add addendum if there are any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Old techie

customer_reviews.title: Kind pricy, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Plugable is a company doing it right. They make a great durable product that works. Their support is also helpful. I have two of these (home and office) and also their hard drive backup and am very pleased. Their products are not cheap, but you get what you pay for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro Compatible! BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a performance system for the COVID-19 Home Office. I Needed multiple monitors to do the job. 3 - ASUS 28" 1080p monitors, 1 LG 34" Ultra-wide with added Caldigit monitor extender, and the laptop itself. Connected to 2020 Apple Macbook Pro - 64 GB Ram, 1tb SSD with an upgraded video card. It works like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: This was a great solution to my issue and the customer service is the best - I highly recommend this product! The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because you have to email customer service (which can be frustrating when you have chords and set up everywhere) and the directions could be more clear for set up.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE O.

customer_reviews.title: Great dock and works with dual monitors
customer_reviews.text: I bought several docks for our office. Our setup is - macbook pro 13" and 15" newer models with USB-C connectors on side. Dual 4k monitors. Web cam and other USBD devices. I was worried about running dual monitors with the dock but this thing has worked flawlessly. No issues with mouse lag or anything like that. One monitor we connect wih the USB-C/Thunderbolt to DisplayPort (that's on the monitor) and the other we use DisplayPort to DisplayPort. Both monitors and everything looks fantastic. Great product. When we come to the office and leave we just plug in 1 cable now instead of multiple.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Cable Management Goodness!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed to help manage the myriad of cables I had on my desk. It eliminates two separate adapters and lets me run multiple monitors. Plus, the camera is better than what I was using before. I've received multiple compliments on it already.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with this type of device before. The Plugable Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station worked out of the box. I am using a Dell Windows 10 laptop. The dock was up and running in less than 5 minutes. Excellent customer support. I connect to two monitors and one was not working. I sent and email to support late on Friday evening and received an individualized, on point reply in about two hours explaining the problem was the cable I was using and how to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: pdf

customer_reviews.title: Power supply can’t keep up
customer_reviews.text: Very handy dock. However, the power supply can’t keep up with my video editing needs. To be fair, video editing is computer intensive but even if I just begin a Dropbox transfer, I need to plug in my laptop’s power supply to supplement the power coming from the dock or else my battery will drain. Bit of a nuisance needing to keep my laptop charger at my desk at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Received item, DisplayPort does not work. Connected included ...
customer_reviews.text: Received item, DisplayPort does not work. Connected included DisplayPort -> HDMI adapter to several HDMI cables and could not get a signal to display. Display over USB-C worked, but DisplayPort was dead. Returning and going to go with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cristiano

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect docking hub for MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Compatibility, versatility, and functionality are excellent when turning my MacBook Pro into a workstation. And kudos for an excellent design. Furthermore, when I did contact the company with a question, the response was rapid and completely covered my question. Certainly more expensive than some of the portable hubs I have tried but absolutely perfect for a workstation.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence E. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly with 2018 MacBook Pro 13", Dell U2518D Monitor, 2 External HDs, Mouse, Keyboard, and Nikon D5600 Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Item works as expected with 2018 MacBook Pro 13". Hooked up to my Dell 2518D UHD IPS LED Monitor via DisplayPort and it works flawlessly. Also running concurrent connections to a USB 3.0 external hard drive, a USB 3.1 external hard drive, keyboard, mouse, and a Nikon D5600 DSLR camera. Already thinking about buying a 2nd one. Original packaging was missing the Thunderbolt cable -- Plugable Support was awesome and has already shipped a new one :)
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: It mostly works
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it will do... most of the time. Sometimes though it will flicker, some of the inputs will stop working then work again. Not as rock solid for the price as I would hope. But like I said... It mostly works.
customer_reviews.author: AGirlUShouldKnow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was slightly overpriced but after receiving it I noticed a few things... Chassis is made of metal, comes with a weighted base, extra HDMI adapter. Functionality wise it worked very good. Everything about the product was high quality. This model is a perfect match for my new MacBook Air Retina connected via display port to a 27” LG monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work at all
customer_reviews.text: When I recieved this thing I was extremely excited about the ergonomic look and all of the great features (4k 60hz and USB-C ports. However, when I went to plug it into my laptop and had all of my other peripherals + external monitor ready and plugged in it just would not connect to my PC! I was troubleshooting for hours and gave up; Definitely not something I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sarkis m.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hub
customer_reviews.text: I received my pluggable tower today. It was an easy hookup. I have a 2019 MacBook Air with thunderbolt 3. It's connected to a 27 inch Acer monitor and a Epson scanner. All works like a charm. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: William Wright

customer_reviews.title: Evan a caveman can do it
customer_reviews.text: My knowledge of computers is limited to be kind. Even without a printed instruction manual, only a basic diagram with terms I'd never heard provided, I was still able to wire up our new Apple Air to an Epson scanner. And it worked. Goes to show even a blind squirrel can find a nut now and again.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Longmire

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of a Dell docking station and still charges at about 75% speed
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of a Dell docking station and still charges at about 75% speed. Has ample ports to cover multiple monitors USB drives USB microphone external mouse and keyboard. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon dave

customer_reviews.title: Had to return, my fault
customer_reviews.text: I missed somewhere that this only worked with MAcBooks running Sierra or earlier software. My new MacBook Pro has High Sierra. My fault. Otherwise it looked like a great docking station. Hook-up was easy, my laptop charged well with it, but peripherals didn't work. Return was easy and refund timely.
customer_reviews.author: Tbijourney

customer_reviews.title: The easiest and best dock I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. It is very expensive and I was hesitant to spend the money but this is the easiest plug and play product I have ever used. I literally can not tell the difference between plugging everything into the laptop or using this dock. It is amazing. If you have a Mac THEN GET IT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Everything connects through USB-C. At first I had problems with getting the sound through the device but tech support was great and was able to walk me through resolving this for me. Great product, great tech support. I have two 27 inch monitors through one USB-C connection to my 13 unch Macbook Pro, touchbar.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Ports
customer_reviews.text: my display will black out from time to time, annoying. my hard drive will disconnect while I'm editing, scary. my Plugable Dock sucks, this is true.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Finally have 4 external monitors + laptop display working
customer_reviews.text: This dock, in conjunction with the pluggable dual HDMI adapter was the setup I finally got working with my MacBook Pro (16-inch, 2019). No display lag. Please use original cables and adapters included with the product. Support replied same day and followed through with troubleshooting very promptly. This is the product you want to get if you want to an additional 4 monitors without an external GPU.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro 2018 Dock that works! (Some quality issues)
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Dock that would work with both my MacBook Pro and my Dell laptop. Both of which were ThunderBolt/USB-C. This dock did the trick! You just need to make sure you are not accidentally downgrading one of the ThunderBolt cables. The downside if after about 9 months the dock will no longer charge my laptop. I have to use the charger that came with my mac. Contacted support now and waiting on a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The holy grail of one wire, two monitors is not achieved with this device as much I tried; various configurations but no dice. The product is fine and works as expected, just not my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work when Mac book pro goes to sleep
customer_reviews.text: I have been using TBT3-UDV to extend my Macbook pro 16 inch 2019 display. When my Macbook goes in to sleep mode the docking station stops extending the display. It won't auto turn on by itself. It needs a restart to extend the display again. I give less than 2 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Janardhan

customer_reviews.title: Some times not working for two monitors
customer_reviews.text: Some times it does not work for two monitors. I need to restart my Mac to fix it. Quite sure it is not the issue of my MacBook because my MacBook works well on the Dell dock in the office,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the first unit. Plugable support was fantastic. Replacement unit worked perfectly. Switching between a pc and a mac book works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: HomeAutomationNerd

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Product, from Top Quality Company
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy to have found this product and Company. Well built and easy to Set Up. Tech Questions and support answered in very short time, and in a friendly and helpful manner. I screwed up some additional orders to this Company, and they went the extra mile to ensure that I was happy and well sorted. Very impressed and no hesitation to give 5 Stars and total recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Roy P.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Finally I can use just _one_ USB type C cable to: - Charge MacBook - Use 2 external monitors, including one 4K - Have Ethernet (works 1.5 times faster than WiFi for my case) - Have USB charging ports ready - No need to buy extra adapters Cons: - None, except relatively high price probably
customer_reviews.author: Andrii Rubtsov

customer_reviews.title: The product support provided is amazing. I had a long discussion prior to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: The product support provided is amazing. I had a long discussion prior to purchase about compatibility and they answered all my questions and also offerred a 30day refund if not satisfactory. When I was installing it I had a problem and they had very prompt and extensive support. It turned out that I had plugged the dock into the wrong port and now everything works perfectly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Esplin

customer_reviews.title: Great product; great service
customer_reviews.text: It works great with my Dell XPS 13. When I had a problem after a windows update, Plugable support was fantastic and helped me find a solution (even though the problem was with the Windows update and not caused by the dock).
customer_reviews.author: Annie McQuilken

customer_reviews.title: The build of the product is excellent, just be sure to check your system compatibility ...
customer_reviews.text: The build of the product is excellent, just be sure to check your system compatibility as thunderbolt is a pretty new technology. I praise Plugable customer support, it is in a league of its own. Congrats to Plugable Team.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Cruz

customer_reviews.title: one works the other was bad out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these stations, one works the other was bad out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Aristi

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: I have this for several month and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: GAM

customer_reviews.title: Great when working, but beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these. They worked great. But one of them just stopped working after a few months, and another stopped working only after one month. They still powered up, but the displays just would no longer work. A blue light on the front of the device just blinks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoffa

customer_reviews.title: Kernel Panics - Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Continually crashed my Macbook Pro anytime the USB ports were used. I was running a 4k monitor and a 1080p monitor so there is no way that it was overloaded. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Docs for the Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This dock is simply the only one that consistently works with my macbook pro. My monitors alway reconnect with no fussy adjustments. Charging is included. The USB-c cable could be a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Works!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality Plugable device. I chose this one over a number of others, and the Reviews from other customers helped me decided on this one.
customer_reviews.author: E. RAY AUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: It'll go through stretches where everything works fine but those are few and far between
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very finicky.I can't tell if its the TB3 port or the cable but if you so much as brush by it the connection is lost. Also, sometimes the monitor flickers, other times my mouse/keyboard won't work. It'll go through stretches where everything works fine but those are few and far between. EDIT: I was sent a new cable from plugable and changed my BIOS settings and now everything is working fine. My only complaints is that I wish the cable was longer and an audio port in the back would have been nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It just works. Mouse and keyboard stay connected and so far never have disconnected. The only downside that you can only connect one external monitor. But it works great and keeps all my cables organized and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Romo

customer_reviews.title: USB-A ports unreliable
customer_reviews.text: It works mostly, except for a couple of the USB-A ports. They are very unreliable, constantly dropping connection.
customer_reviews.author: Honorable Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my 2018 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: My 2018 MacBook Pro gives the message "Cannot Use Thunderbolt Accessory - Connect accessory to a Thunderbolt port on this mac" when plugged into the doc via a Thunderbolt port. Frustrated with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play, fairly intuitive, had to look at the instructions, working nicely now!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Finger MD

customer_reviews.title: Solid build quality, and good Mac compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Been going strong for several months. My previous docking stations were flaky at best, especially with video out. This one has functioned without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have the thunderbolt 3 cable plugged into the USB-C port with a computer next to it!
customer_reviews.text: This dock is great, it simplifies all of the plugging/unplugging of peripherals to my MacBook Pro 13 whenever I want to use my dual monitor setup. The charging functionality is also fantastic. One quick note on the charging I just alluded to - in order to recharge your Mac and not simply sustain the battery's current charge you MUST have the provided ThunderBolt 3 cable plugged into the USB-C port that has the little computer icon next to it. I nearly returned this item thinking that it wouldn't actually charge my computer and I'm so glad I double checked that. I'd definitely recommend this to other MacBook Pro 13/Macbook users wanting to simplify a desktop setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Docking station for MacBook Pro thunderbolt ports
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and works great for my 13” MacBook Pro 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Does what it said it would do
customer_reviews.text: 2019 Macbook Air owner. Does what it was advertised to do. Two Dell screens. Ethernet connection. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cozz

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking to add to my setup. It works as advertised. I have had zero issues. August 2020 Update: Still works exactly as expected. One of the most valuable aspects of my setup and better purchases i've made in the past few years.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted to simplify my work desk setup
customer_reviews.text: I use two monitors, headphones, my laptop and it all connects seamlessly. So excited to have found something that only requires one input to my laptop for all the things!
customer_reviews.author: Alichia S

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to connect an HP Spectre X360 8th Gen i7 to a single monitor, two external hard drives, printer, ect. Works perfectly with the Spectre, was immediately recognized and everything has been plug and play. Only wish was that it had a speaker out connection on the back so all my "permanent" connections were in the rear of the dock. As it is, I have the speakers on my desk connected to the front speaker/microphone jack. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool that you can use to gather all different devices in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Dose not work waste of money. Useless. I will never buy anything from this company
customer_reviews.author: Uri Wolpert

customer_reviews.title: Decent TBT3 docking station
customer_reviews.text: No issues with the external monitor (newest Dell S2719DM) with 2560x1440 resolution at 60Hz. External HDDs (WD) have a stable average download/upload speeds of 100 Mb/S. Also, you can connect your old USB data hub and enjoy even more extended connectivity. I bought the dock to improve the connectivity of my brand new Dell XPS 9370 laptop. I had some difficulties with the external HDDs in the beginning, but the Plugable Support Team (kudos to Bob) was able to provide an immediate assistance - I simply updated the Thunderbolt 3 NVM firmware to the latest version.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Power charing issue after waked-up
customer_reviews.text: It works fine including the power charging function. But It is no charging to my Mac Pro(Sierra 10.13.1) after It is waked-up from power saving mode. To fix this, it need to be reconnected the power cable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!! Provides additional connections to one Thunderbolt 3 device
customer_reviews.text: Great product to provide additional connections to one of my MacBook Pros Thunderbolt 3 connectors. Using one Thunderbolt 3 connection, I can now connect to USB 3.0 (5 ports), HDMI, ethernet, daisy chain to other Thunderbolt 3 devices and enjoy audio in/out with this docking station. This device can provide 60W of power to a Thunderbolt 3 device since it has it's own power supply. The only downside is it is not as easily portable as other passive plug and play Thunderbolt 3 connectors.
customer_reviews.author: JJinHI

customer_reviews.title: Great Docking station for Thunderbolt 3
customer_reviews.text: This docking station works really well. It even charges the laptop, I have an HP Spectre 15t that it was not supposed to charge because the original power supply is 80 or 90 watt, it but it does. Even my older Fujitso scaner fi-6230 works perfect. I have a little problem in the initial authentication process (partly my error) and customer service reply to my email in 20 minutes solved the issue. A week later all is working perfect.
customer_reviews.author: R. Torre

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very unreliable docking station. I have been using this for a few weeks now. The display port has become unstable and most of the times will not work unless I power cycle the docking station several times. The ethernet port also doesn't work. Do not buy. This is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The big problem I had with this dock was that ...
customer_reviews.text: The big problem I had with this dock was that it would be extremely finicky with displaying 2 screens from a MacBook Pro. I plugged on monitor into the DisplayPort and bout the Plugable branded usbc to DisplayPort cable for the other monitor. Often when plugging my computer in, one of the monitors would simply not be detected and I had to spend a few minutes plugging and unplugging in the power, and various display ports. I ended up switching to this dock  (Mantiz Titan-Thunderbolt 3 with 2 displayports) and it hasn't had this problem. Other than this monitor issue the dock seemed work alright.
customer_reviews.author: gltovar

customer_reviews.title: but it just a little bit annoying.
customer_reviews.text: It mostly works well as a dock and port replicator. I'm using it with a 4k monitor and a 2016 15" MacBook Pro in clamshell mode. Single cable to the mac gets me 4k 60 Hz video, digital audio, USB, etc. 4 stars because it struggles sometimes if the Mac has been asleep for a while, leading to the need to power cycle the dock to get it to work again. I can't leave a hard drive plugged in indefinitely or it will unmount and remount on sleep cycles. I've had zero issues or glitches during use though. Everything seems related to sleep. So it works well, but it just a little bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Block

customer_reviews.title: At first I loved it. Then ...
customer_reviews.text: Constantly, and I do mean CONSTANTLY turns my MacBook Pro touchbar on. Within about 10 seconds of shutting the Mac down, this reboots it. I have unplugged EVERYTHING from the dock and it still does it. I literally can not have my Mac OFF. It's beyond a joke. UPDATE: EVEN WITH THE CLAMSHELL CLOSED, it still wake the machine up. Fans are running as I type this. Absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: IA

customer_reviews.title: One cable does it all
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Dell Latitude 7480 laptop for work and bring my computer home each night. I started looking for a port replicator/docking station so I wouldn’t have to keep plugging/un-plugging cables while at work. The Plubable Thurderbolt 3 docking station (TDT3-UDV) offered everything I need plus charging capability! This allows one plug connectivity and I can keep my travel charger at home which lightens my computer bag. A Display Port to HDMI adaptor is included so I didn’t have to purchase extra adaptors. Installation was simple, plugged it in and it worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michael - Houston, TX

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and connectivity in a unit that is less expensive than other docks with less
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly and on time. Space saving design works great. Personally, I wish that there were more than 2 thunderbolt 3 plugs, but maybe someday. No other docks have3 either. One other thing. I purchased this unit based on some research online. The reviews were right. Great unit, great price, offers more than some more expensive docks. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kasden

customer_reviews.title: Great product, expertly supported!
customer_reviews.text: The product is amazing and does exactly as promised. The support is even better. I had an issue about two months after purchase, (unit failed) and Plugable support took care of my nearly immediately. Replacement unit sent via priority. Prepaid return. Seriously, I love these guys and think that the support alone has me as a customer for life!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Simek

customer_reviews.title: Works with 2017 Apple MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the Pluggable USB 4.0 Dual Display Docking station with 2 additional screens (total 3 screens with the Apple screen), which quit working after the MacOS update to 10.13.4 (and beyond). This fixes the problem as it doesn't use DisplayLink technology. Took about 3 minutes to hook up and works great. Only complaint is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Mike1966

customer_reviews.title: working perfectly with my MBP 2017 15" and two 4K displays
customer_reviews.text: This dock is working perfectly with my MBP 2017 15" and two 4K displays, both connected using DisplayPort. The second display is using a Plugable USB-C to DisplayPort Adapter Cable which was recommended on the TBT3-UDV page.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Got a dud - no response from seller - returned
customer_reviews.text: This unit has nice fit-n-finish and has surprising heft to it; unfortunately, all of the USB-A ports just flat stopped working after a few hours of use. I contacted the seller hoping they would have some reset sequence that would get this thing back up and running, but I have heard nothing back from them. I'll be returning it. Perhaps mine was just a dud, but the lack of response from the seller is enough for me to not try again.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: At last, my dream computer set up
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a desktop and laptop at home and was just tired of managing both systems. My Dell XPS13 is powerful enough for photo-editing, so I decided to ditch the desktop. This docking station barely takes of any room -- one plug in and it works. I couldn't be happier with my new set-up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Two monitors cannot work together.
customer_reviews.text: I have a macbook pro 2017. I have to monitor are all from LG, one is LG 34UM59-P 34" 21:9 FreeSync IPS Monitor with resolution 2560 x 1080 and another one is LG 27UD60-B 27" 16:9 UHD IPS 4K Gaming Monitor with resolution 3840 x 2160. In most of time, they cannot be open at the same time when I connect my computer to the docking. Only one of them can be opened and another one shows "No signals". I doubt this is because of the difference of the resolutions. Posted a question and wait for the response.
customer_reviews.author: Fan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, easy to use, does 3 monitors extended (not 4K) - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Using with DELL XPS 15, and it easily uses 3 monitors extended. I do not use 4K, so this serves my purposes perfectly. Researched several products, including Dell's solution - but this seemed to have the best customer reviews.
customer_reviews.author: A. Struthers

customer_reviews.title: Works with Lenovo X1 Yoga 2nd Generation (20JGS07S00).
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier - works as advertised with Lenovo X1 Yoga 2nd Generation (20JGS07S00). Everything is routed thru ONE USB-C/Thunderbolt 3 cable to laptop! 60W Power Delivery Charging, Video, Ethernet, and Sound with 5 available USB 3.0 Type A ports.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond G.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Yoga 920
customer_reviews.text: So far, this dock is working great with my Lenovo Yoga 920. Charging and a second monitor (using USB-C to HDMI cable) are working perfectly. I have a USB hub daisy-chained to one of the USB ports, and that is working fine as well. The Thunderbolt 3/USB-C cable is rather short, but this seems to be an issue with all the docks and must have something to do with the pricing for 40GB certified cables (since evidently, even a 1m passive cable is in the $70 price range). When I first plugged in the dock, I was prompted to install some software and then prompted allow the dock to mount. But since then, everything has just worked.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Baker

customer_reviews.title: works better than previous models from Pluggable
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the older models, they cause our Macs to hang during startup, BUT this model works perfectly Worth the additional cost to get one that works
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup to Ultra 4K monitor and thunderbolt laptop
customer_reviews.text: Delivered super quick. Easy hookup to Dell XPS laptop with thunderbolt cable. Way better than a prior Kensington product I had. Super functional seamless docking station!
customer_reviews.author: SCF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent docking station for Win10 & OSX Sierra
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product. Works as advertised. Not cheap but, then, it's very well made. I only wish it supported Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Burgher

customer_reviews.title: I've been able to reproduce the problem easily. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Since plugging this very expensive device into my MBpro, it has caused multiple kernel panics and restarts. I've been able to reproduce the problem easily. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Nice dock. Great support from Plugable
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue getting 2 displays to work at first with my Macbook Pro 2017 but it turned out to be a bad TB3 cable. Plugable Support diagnosed the problem and sent me a new cable which fixed it. Liking the dock now - works great with the Macbook Pro and Dell XPS 15 9560.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solid gear!
customer_reviews.text: This is some solid gear. The tech support was responsive when I couldn't get the ethernet port to work right away. It works great with my MacBook Pro with Thunderbolt 3, a LG 34um95 thunderbolt monitor, and a USB hard drive. If it were a little cheaper, I'd give it 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy_in_Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new (2017) MacBook Pro and this docking station works fantastic. No glitches, works perfect. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Had a problem with the original Thunderbolt cable ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had a problem with the original Thunderbolt cable that came with it, but Plugable support shipped me a new one right away and now it works great. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sean Leach

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, it works well
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, it works well. Most USB Ports of any dock I've seen. Great customer service by email from Plugable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worked Right out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box with my 2017 macbook pro. Setup using two external monitors.
customer_reviews.author: macallien

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Docking Station
customer_reviews.text: Setup was very easy. Convenient. Works like a charm. Well worth the price - You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Nono Marco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to plug and play. Just make sure you get the right adapters to work with your monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rondeau

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, reliable, charges MacBook 13" quickly, loads of connectivity...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant! I have used this for a week now, totally stable, hasn't disconnected drives randomly unlike some previous thunderbolt 2 docks I have owned. As an audio producer, I have loads of external gear Its great to just be able to plug one cable into my 13 inch MacBook Pro and have all the connectivity I need. I'm impressed with the speed at which the battery charges, I'd read some info online saying that the plugable unit wouldn't charge MacBooks as quickly as it's own USB-C charger, however this didn't seem to have an impact with my current setup. Looks great and my desk is clutter free!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Overall very nice, but for this price something like the power ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall very nice, but for this price something like the power cord not fully inserting I would expect to be a non issue (see picture, power cord won't insert any further). I also hope this isn't a safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: PalidinoDH

customer_reviews.title: It's so nice to have just 1 cable going into your laptop
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned it a few days, but it's working exactly as described. It's so nice to have just 1 cable going into your laptop. Makes transitioning from desktop to laptop mode so much easier and faster. It's pricey, but it works and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 3 months. I am using it with a brand new Dell XPS and so far it has performed very well. I only wish I could open my laptop and get a 3rd screen. Oh.. and that it had a power on button. But those are just details that do not influence my rating.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tichy

product_meta.title: Plugable Thunderbolt 3 Dock with Charging Compatible with MacBook Pro 2019 2018 2017 and Specific Windows Laptops (Supports DisplayPort or HDMI up to 4K 60, Gigabit Ethernet, Audio, 5 USB 3.0 Ports)
feature_bullets: FEATURES - The Plugable TBT3-UDV Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station provides up to 60W of power to compatible Thunderbolt 3 systems. Enables an additional display, wired gigabit Intel Ethernet, audio input/output, and USB expansion with 1x Thunderbolt 3 port (40Gbps), and 5x USB 3.0 ports (5Gbps). Made from anodized aluminum with a space gray finish, the TBT3-UDV includes a removable stand for vertical or horizontal orientation

FLEXIBLE CONNECTIVITY - Connect a single display up to 4K 60Hz (4096×2160@60Hz) via the integrated DisplayPort output, or an HDMI display using the included Active DisplayPort to HDMI 2.0 adapter. Also supports popular lower resolution modes such as 3440x1440, 2560x1600, 2560x1440, 2560x1080, 1920x1080 (1080P)

MASSIVE EXPANDABILITY - The second Thunderbolt 3 port on the dock supports a second monitor on the following systems when using a USB-C Alt Mode video adapter (sold separately): Late 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019 MacBook Pro, Late 2018 / 2019 MacBook Air, and Dell Thunderbolt 3 systems. Second Thunderbolt 3 port on dock supports up to 5 daisy chained Thunderbolt 3 devices or a single USB 3.1 Gen 2 (10Gbps) device

DISPLAYPORT DETAILS - Supports native DisplayPort monitor or HDMI using included DP to HDMI 2.0 Active Adapter. Not compatible with Dual-Link DVI monitors and not for previous generation Thunderbolt 1 & 2 systems. Please see additional important compatibility details regarding Windows systems below
2 YEAR WARRANTY - We love our Plugable products, and hope you will too. All of our products are backed with a 2 year limited parts and labor warranty as well as Seattle-based email support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars244 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
